com.adventnet.snmp.snmp2
Class SnmpIpv4Address

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.adventnet.snmp.snmp2.SnmpVar
        |
        +--com.adventnet.snmp.snmp2.SnmpIpv4Address
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class SnmpIpv4Address
extends SnmpVar

Class of SNMP Ipv4Address Variable - Sub-class of SnmpVar. This class can be used to create a SnmpVar object of OCTET STRING TC such as InetAddressIPv4 and InetAddressIPv4z. It also has methods to retrieve the values in different forms(eg. String, byte). Value is stored as String of length 4/8 with each lower byte corresponding to the raw IPV4/IPV4z address.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

enc

public static java.lang.String enc
The Standard encoding string on which all encoding will be done. This will refer to SnmpAPI for the encoding string.

Constructor Detail

SnmpIpv4Address

public SnmpIpv4Address(java.lang.String ipv4Address)
                throws SnmpException
Constructs a new SnmpIpv4Address with the specified host name or IP address as a string. Throws SnmpException in case of errors. To ensure that a valid IpAddress is created, always try to use a dot format ipv4/ipv4z address. Supplying host name to this constructor could result in delays caused by DNS lookups and in case a failure occurs then the toValue will return a null. If DNS lookups returns ipaddress as ipv4, it will create SnmpIpv4Address instance as with ipv4Address. If a 'null' parameter is passed as an argument to this constructor, then the object will be initialized with the IP-address "0.0.0.0"

Parameters:
ipv4Address - host name or IP address as a string.

SnmpIpv4Address

public SnmpIpv4Address(java.lang.String ipv4Address,
                       java.lang.String enc)
                throws SnmpException
Constructs a new SnmpIpv4Address with the specified host name or IP address as a string. Throws SnmpException in case of errors. To ensure that a valid IpAddress is created, always try to use a dot format ipv4/ipv4z address. Supplying host name to this constructor could result in delays caused by DNS lookups and in case a failure occurs then the toValue will return a null. If DNS lookups returns ipaddress as ipv4, it will create SnmpIpv4Address instance as with ipv4Address. If a 'null' parameter is passed as an argument to this constructor, then the object will be initialized with the IP-address "0.0.0.0".

Parameters:
ipv4Address - host name or IP address as a string.
enc - The string for the encoding scheme to be used.

SnmpIpv4Address

public SnmpIpv4Address(byte[] address)
                throws SnmpException
Constructs a new SnmpIpv4Address by accepting the raw IP address - 4 bytes or 8 bytes for Ipv4Address/Ipv4zAddress/InetAddress datatype.

Parameters:
address - raw IPv4/IPv4z address - 4 bytes/ 8 bytes

toBytes

public byte[] toBytes()
To return the value of this SnmpString object as raw bytes. To avoid any kind of problems with String encoding, one can use this method to retrive the value. Similarly one can use the new SnmpString(byte[]) for creating new SnmpString object. With these methods none of the String encoding routines in java is used. Instead it uses the bytes directly.

Specified by:
toBytes in class SnmpVar
Returns:
The value of this SnmpIpv4Address as byte value.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
To convert the value of this SnmpString object to a printable ipv4Address/ipv4zAddress format

Specified by:
toString in class SnmpVar
Returns:
the value of SnmpString object as a printable string.

Ipv4bToString

public static java.lang.String Ipv4bToString(byte[] byteValue)
A converter from raw IP address (byte[]) to string. This takes the IP address as a byte[] and returns as a string in the form x.x.x.x/x.x.x.x%x .

Returns:
The value of the IPAddress as a string in the form x.x.x.x/x.x.x.x%x .

toTagString

public java.lang.String toTagString()
To convert the value of this SnmpString object to a printable string where the type is tagged before the value with a tag STRING:. For e.g if the SnmpString has the value 7F 00 00 01 00 00 00 08, then this method will return - STRING: 127.0.0.1%8. If the SnmpString has the value of 7F 00 00 01, then this method will return STRING - 127.0.0.1

Specified by:
toTagString in class SnmpVar
Returns:
the value of SnmpString object as a printable string where the type is tagged before the value with a Tag - STRING: ipv4Address/ipv4zAddress value.

createVariable

public static SnmpVar createVariable(java.lang.String value,
                                     byte type)
                              throws SnmpException
Creates a new SnmpVar object with the specified value and of type SnmpAPI.STRING.

Parameters:
value - String value for creating a new SnmpVar object.
type - SnmpAPI.STRING type (a constant from SnmpAPI) for creating a new SnmpVar object.
Returns:
the SnmpVar object created.
Throws:
SnmpException - is thrown when the type is other than SnmpAPI.STRING.
